predunder.functions module

src.predunder.functions.convert_labels(labels)[source]

Converts labels to ordinal numbers.

Parameters

labels (numpy.ndarray[str]) – array of labels for supervised learning

Returns

converted array of labels

Return type

numpy.ndarray[int]

src.predunder.functions.df_to_dataset(dataframe, label, shuffle=True, batch_size=8)[source]

Convert a Pandas DataFrame into a Tensorflow Dataset.

Parameters

  • dataframe (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame to be converted

  • label (str) – name of the target column for supervised learning

  • shuffle (bool, optional) – shuffles the dataset

  • batch_size (int, optional) – batch size of the dataset

Returns

Tensorflow Dataset based on the DataFrame

Return type

tensorflow.data.Dataset

Note

The dataframe is required to have this as one of its columns.

src.predunder.functions.df_to_nparray(dataframe, label)[source]

Split a Pandas DataFrame into features and labels.

Parameters

  • dataframe (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame to be converted

  • label – name of the target column for supervised learning

Returns

features and labels for supervised learning

Return type

(numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray)

Note

The dataframe is required to have this as one of its columns.

Todo

This is currently not being used anywhere.

src.predunder.functions.get_metrics(predicted, actual)[source]

Extract relevant metrics from predictions.

Parameters

  • predicted (numpy.ndarray) – array of predictions

  • actual (numpy.ndarray) – array of ground truth

Returns

model evaluation metrics (accuracy, sensitivity, specificity)

Return type

(float, float, float)

Todo

This currently does not have Cohen’s Kappa.

Todo

This only supports binary classification.

src.predunder.functions.kfold_metrics_to_df(metrics, include_all=False, include_stdev=True)[source]

Convert a k-fold metrics dictionary into a Pandas DataFrame row for analysis.

Parameters

  • metrics (dict) – dictionary of metrics from predunder.training.train_kfold(..)

  • include_all (bool, optional) – includes a list of all the metrics per fold

  • include_stdev (bool, optional) – includes the standard devation of metrics across folds

Returns

DataFrame with a single row

Return type

pandas.DataFrame

src.predunder.functions.normalize(train, test)[source]

Normalize training and testing values using training mean and standard deviation.

Parameters

  • train (np.ndarray[float]) – numpy array of training set

  • test (np.ndarray[float]) – numpy array of testing set

Returns

normalized train and normalized test

Return type

Tuple[np.ndarray[float], np.ndarray[float]]

src.predunder.functions.oversample_data(train_set, label, oversample='none', random_state=42)[source]

Perform oversampling over the minority class using the specific technique.

Parameters

  • train_set (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame of the training set

  • label (str) – name of the target column for supervised learning

  • oversample (str, optional) – oversampling algorithm to be applied (“none”, “smote”, “adasyn”, “borderline”)

  • random_state (int, optional) – random seed for oversampling

Returns

DataFrame of training set with oversampled data

Return type

pandas.DataFrame

predunder.hypertuning module

src.predunder.hypertuning.tune_dnn(train, label, folds, max_nodes, oversample='none')[source]

Brute force number of nodes in a neural network up to three hidden layers.

Parameters

  • train (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame of the training set

  • label (str) – name of the target column for supervised learning

  • fold (int) – number of folds for k-fold cross-validation

  • max_nodes (int) – maximum number of nodes per layer

  • oversample (str, optional) – oversampling algorithm to be applied (“none”, “smote”, “adasyn”, “borderline”)

Returns

DataFrame of results

Return type

pandas.DataFrame

src.predunder.hypertuning.tune_model(train, label, folds, train_func, param_grid, **kwargs)[source]

Performs grid search cross validation on Cohen’s Kappa

Parameters

  • train (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame of the training set

  • label (str) – name of the target column for supervised learning

  • fold (int) – number of folds for k-fold cross-validation

  • train_func (Callable[..., (float,float,float)]) – training function of the model being validated

  • param_grid (dict[str, list]) – grid of parameters to hypertune with

Returns

best parameters

Return type

dict

predunder.training module

src.predunder.training.train_dnn(train, test, label, layers, epochs=1, oversample='none', random_state=42)[source]

Train a dense neural network model and make predictions.

Parameters

  • train (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame of the training set

  • test (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame of the testing set

  • label (str) – name of the target column for supervised learning

  • layers (list[int]) – number of nodes per hidden layer in the neural network

  • oversample (str, optional) – oversampling algorithm to be applied (“none”, “smote”, “adasyn”, “borderline”)

Returns

array of class predictions

Return type

np.ndarray[int]

Todo

Build custom evaluation functions to get the model predictions with Tensorflow.

Todo

This only supports binary classification.

src.predunder.training.train_kfold(train_set, label, num_fold, train_func, random_state=42, **kwargs)[source]

Validate a model with stratified k-fold cross validation.

Parameters

  • train_set (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame of the training set

  • label (str) – name of the target column for supervised learning

  • num_fold (int) – number of folds

  • train_func (Callable[..., (float,float,float)]) – training function of the model being validated

  • **kwargs –

    other keyword arguments for the training function

Returns

dictionary of metrics.

Return type

dict[‘ACCURACY’|’SENSITIVITY’|’SPECIFICITY’ | ‘KAPPA’][‘ALL’|’MEAN’|’STD’]

..todo:: This only supports binary classification.

src.predunder.training.train_nnrf(train, test, label, oversample='none', to_normalize=True, learning_rate=0.001, l1=0, l2=0, random_state=42, **kwargs)[source]

Train an NNRF model and make predictions.

Parameters

  • train (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame of the training set

  • test (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame of the testing set

  • label (str) – name of the target column for supervised learning

  • oversample (str, optional) – oversampling algorithm to be applied (“none”, “smote”, “adasyn”, “borderline”)

  • to_normalize (bool, optional) – normalize features

  • learning_rate (float, optional) – learning rate of optimizer

  • reg_factor (float, optional) – L2 regularization factor

Returns

array of class predictions

Return type

np.ndarray[int]

src.predunder.training.train_random_forest(train, test, label, oversample='none', to_normalize=False, random_state=42, **kwargs)[source]

Train a random forest model and make predictions.

Parameters

  • test (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame of the testing set

  • label (str) – name of the target column for supervised learning

  • oversample (str, optional) – oversampling algorithm to be applied (“none”, “smote”, “adasyn”, “borderline”)

  • to_normalize (bool, optional) – normalize features

Returns

array of class predictions

Return type

np.ndarray[int]
